text.#text: The

term.#tail:

			 purchased or surrendered to such agency.

text.#text:
A
			 law enforcement agency described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may make a
			 grant under this section to a law enforcement agency described in

, with respect to a gun buyback program, only if the application submitted
			 under
by such agency provides assurances that—

text.#text: The

the law enforcement agency will adequately
			 advertise such program to the public;

such program will be administered by law
			 enforcement personnel;

all guns received through such program will
			 remain in the possession of law enforcement personnel;

adequate safeguards will be established and
			 followed to prevent the occurrence of fraud in such program;

the law enforcement agency will have in
			 place a process to test on site a gun purchased from an individual through such
			 program before payment is provided to such individual; and

an adequate process will be in place to
			 destroy all guns received through such program.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, to be eligible for a grant under this section, a law enforcement agency
			 must certify that the law enforcement agency will match all Federal funds
			 provided under such grant with an equal amount of cash or in-kind goods or
			 services from other non-Federal sources.

text.#text: The

, shall enter into an arrangement with the National Academy of
			 Sciences to develop standards for identifying, and identify, guns that are the
			 most likely to be used in violent crimes and establish a pricing scale for
			 purchasing guns so identified through gun buyback programs receiving grants
			 under this section.

For purposes of this section:
